challenge.title: Global vs. Local Scope in Functions
challenge.description:
It is possible to have both local and global variables with the same name. When you do this, the local variable takes precedence over the global variable.

In this example:

const someVar = "Hat";

function myFun() {
  const someVar = "Head";
  return someVar;
}

The function myFun will return the string Head because the local version of the variable is present.
challenge.instructions: Add a local variable to myOutfit function to override the value of outerWear with the string sweater.

tests.text: You should not change the value of the global outerWear.
